pageContext.claim: “What I would suggest as -- I was not happy with [the chant]. But what I would suggest: You go there, go to North Carolina, and you ask the people why did they say that. But that's what they said. That's what they -- Well, I didn't like that they did it. And I started speaking very quickly. I could have -- I could have stood --Really? If you would have heard, there was tremendous amount of noise and action and everything else. I started very quickly. And I think you know that.”
pageContext.analysis: Video of the rally shows Trump did not try to stop the “Send her back!” chants about Omar. He stood passively onstage and waited for the chants to die down on their own before resuming his speech. Within seconds, he was back to criticizing Omar. Minutes later, he suggested again that Omar and other critics leave the United States.
